body_html:
That error message is caffe2/caffe2#1980 , but you shouldn't be getting it any more. The output of gcc --version is 5.4 ?

When you run conda list are any of these packages from 'conda-forge'? That would cause this problem. If your gcc version is 5.4 or higher then you should not use libraries from conda-forge.

It looks like Caffe2 is installed into all the right places, but there is a ABI mismatch between some of the libraries on your machine; some were built with gcc 4.8.5 and some were built with gcc 5.4 or 7.2, and these libraries are not compatible with each other.

When you run conda list are any of these packages from 'conda-forge'? That would cause this problem. If your gcc version is 5.4 or higher then you should not use libraries from conda-forge.
It looks like Caffe2 is installed into all the right places, but there is a ABI mismatch between some of the libraries on your machine; some were built with gcc 4.8.5 and some were built with gcc 5.4 or 7.2, and these libraries are not compatible with each other.
body:
That error message is https://github.com/caffe2/caffe2/issues/1980 , but you shouldn't be getting it any more. The output of `gcc --version` is 5.4 ?

When you run `conda list` are any of these packages from 'conda-forge'? That would cause this problem. If your gcc version is 5.4 or higher then you should not use libraries from conda-forge.

It looks like Caffe2 is installed into all the right places, but there is a ABI mismatch between some of the libraries on your machine; some were built with gcc 4.8.5 and some were built with gcc 5.4 or 7.2, and these libraries are not compatible with each other.
